metaData.descriptionCS: The examinee is asked to retell the story from the immediate condition. Then the examinee is asked yes/no questions about the story.

responseItems.label: Ruth
responseItems.onePointResponse: Ruthie
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: Ruby, Rudy, any other name

responseItems.label: and Paul
responseItems.onePointResponse: Paulie
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: Feminine versions such as Paula or Pauline, any other name

responseItems.label: have been friends
responseItems.onePointResponse: who were friends, they are friends
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: they were married, they worked together, any other relationship

responseItems.label: for thirty
responseItems.criteria: thirty (in any context) is required, reference to years is not required
responseItems.onePointResponse: 30 days
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: any other numeric response

responseItems.label: years.
responseItems.criteria: year(s) is required, reference to specific number of years is not required
responseItems.onePointResponse: knew each other for years, friends for years, friends for a few years
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: knew each other for days/months, knew each other for a long time

responseItems.label: They meet
responseItems.onePointResponse: get together, hang out, see each other
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: run into each other, accidentally met, any indication the two characters do not intentionally meet

responseItems.label: every
responseItems.criteria: every (in reference to Tuesday only) or on Tuesdays
responseItems.onePointResponse: every Tuesday, Tuesdays, each Tuesday, every week on Tuesday
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: every week, meet often, every day

responseItems.label: Tuesday
responseItems.onePointResponse: Tuesday
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: any other day of the week

responseItems.label: at Alma's
responseItems.onePointResponse: Alma's Diner, Alma's Restaurant, Alma's Place
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: any other name

responseItems.label: Diner
responseItems.onePointResponse: Diner
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: Restaurant, Place, Caf√©

responseItems.label: for breakfast
responseItems.onePointResponse: eat breakfast, have breakfast, break the fast
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: lunch, dinner, any other meal, to eat with no reference to a type of meal

responseItems.label: and then they go for a walk
responseItems.onePointResponse: take a stroll, walk around
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: go for a jog/run, any other activity

responseItems.label: in Mason
responseItems.onePointResponse: Mason Diner, Mason Zoo, Mason Lake
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: any other name

responseItems.label: Park.
responseItems.onePointResponse: Mason Park, Alma's park, the park
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: any other place

responseItems.label: Anna
responseItems.criteria: Anna or a variant of the name
responseItems.onePointResponse: Ann, Annie, Annette
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: Angela, Allison, any other name

responseItems.label: Thompson
responseItems.onePointResponse: Thompson
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: Thompkins, Thomas, any other name

responseItems.label: of South
responseItems.onePointResponse: from South, who lived in the South, who came from the South
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: any other location/direction

responseItems.label: Boston,
responseItems.onePointResponse: who worked in Boston, on a trip to Boston
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: any other city

responseItems.label: employed
responseItems.onePointResponse: worked, had a job as, who earned a living as
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: employed a cook, wanted to be a cook, was a cook

responseItems.label: as a cook
responseItems.criteria: cook or some form of the word (e.g., cooked) is required
responseItems.onePointResponse: who cooked
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: as a waitress, in the kitchen

responseItems.label: in a school
responseItems.onePointResponse: at a high school, by a school
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: in a hospital, at a company

responseItems.label: cafeteria,
responseItems.onePointResponse: school cafeteria, lunch cafeteria
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: lunchroom, dining hall, diner, restaurant, kitchen

responseItems.label: reported
responseItems.criteria: indication that a formal statement was made to someone in authority (in any context)
responseItems.onePointResponse: filed a complaint, said to the police, made a statement, notified the police, called the police, told the police
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: said, told how

responseItems.label: at the police
responseItems.onePointResponse: police, the cops
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: any other organization

responseItems.label: station
responseItems.criteria: station (in any context) or a word or phrase denoting a police station
responseItems.onePointResponse: department, headquarters
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: office, building

responseItems.label: that she had been held up
responseItems.criteria: indication that she had been held up (e.g., gunpoint or knife)
responseItems.onePointResponse: gunpoint, knifepoint, that someone held her up, that she was in a stick-up
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: that she was beaten, she was attacked, she got mugged

responseItems.label: on State Street
responseItems.onePointResponse: she lived on State Street, on her way to State Street
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: State Avenue, any other street

responseItems.label: the night before
responseItems.criteria: indication that the hold-up occurred the previous night
responseItems.onePointResponse: last night, the previous night
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: at night, one night, yesterday, the day before

responseItems.label: and robbed
responseItems.criteria: indication that a robbery took place (implication that money was taken)
responseItems.onePointResponse: was robbed, her money was stolen, they took her money, someone took her purse
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: lost her money, somebody took her things

responseItems.label: of fifty-six dollars.
responseItems.criteria: indication that an amount of money greater than $49 but less than $60 was taken from her
responseItems.onePointResponse: 50-some dollars, 55 dollars, about 50 dollars
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: 65 dollars, a lot of money, the police collected her money for her

responseItems.label: She had four
responseItems.criteria: four is required, together with an indication that the children were hers
responseItems.onePointResponse: she was the mother of four, she had four kids
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: she had two, she had some, there were some

responseItems.label: small children,
responseItems.onePointResponse: little children, kids, small kids, young children
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: babies, girls, sons, small boys, daughters

responseItems.label: the rent was due,
responseItems.onePointResponse: she had not paid the rent, she owed for the rent, the landlord had to be paid, she needed money for the rent
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: she owed money, she needed money, there was no money

responseItems.label: and they had not eaten
responseItems.criteria: indication that her children or the family were without food
responseItems.onePointResponse: they had gone without food, they were hungry, there was no food, her kids had nothing to eat, she couldn't feed her family
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: there wasn't much food, they had only a little food, she had not eaten, didn't have money to buy food, no reference to children not eating

responseItems.label: for two days.
responseItems.criteria: two days is required or a phrase meaning about two days (e.g., couple of days)
responseItems.onePointResponse: for a couple of days, for one or two days, for two or three days
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: for days, for several days, for a day, for three days

responseItems.label: The police,
responseItems.criteria: word or phrase signifying one or more members of the police department (in any context)
responseItems.onePointResponse: the cops, the policemen, the detectives, the police, officers, they (clearly indicating police)
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: they (unspecified), some people, her neighbors, somebody

responseItems.label: touched by the woman's story,
responseItems.onePointResponse: were touched, felt sorry for the woman, wanted to help her, were sympathetic
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: listened to her story, helped her, believed her

responseItems.label: took up a collection
responseItems.criteria: indication that money or a donation was collected
responseItems.onePointResponse: chipped in, collected money, donated, collected some food
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: gave her some money, found some money

responseItems.label: for her.
responseItems.criteria: indication that the money collected was for her or her children
responseItems.onePointResponse: and gave it to her, for her children, for her family, for them, to help her out
responseItems.zeroPointResponse: as a gift, to make things better

items.question: Is one of the people in the story named Ruth?
Is the other person named Paul?
Does the story say that the two people are married?
Have they been friends for twenty years?
Do they meet every Tuesday?
Do they eat lunch at Mason's Restaurant?
After breakfast, do they watch birds at Paul's house?
Do they walk in Mason Park?
Was the woman's name Diana Thompson?
Was the story set in South Boston?
Was the woman a cook?
Did she work in a restaurant?
Did she have four children?
Were the children teenagers?
Did the robbery take place on Sixth Street?
Did the woman report being robbed two nights before?
Did she report the robbery at the police station?
Was the woman robbed of seventy-five dollars?
Did the family go without food for four days?
Was the rent due?
Did the police catch the thief?
Did the police feel sorry for the woman?
Did the police take up a collection?
